primary_factors: Rockford Public Schools is already scheduled CLOSED for Mid-Winter Break on Mon Feb 16, 2026 (official calendar + multiple district reminders/news posts)
No meaningful wintry precipitation signal: ~0" snow / ~0 precip expected; no winter headlines
No extreme cold trigger: web verification found no credible ≤ -20°F wind chill during 6–8 AM; even the colder Weather.com scenario (~14–16°F feels-like) is not closure-level for Michigan by itself

Main operational hazard is freezing fog/low clouds with patchy black ice risk (visibility + isolated slick spots), which would more typically cause caution or at most a delay if school were in session
Infrastructure and power conditions are supportive: roads generally clear/normal patrol; outages essentially zero in Kent County (not a closure driver)
decision_rationale:
This is not a weather-dependent snow day decision for Rockford Public Schools on Mon 2/16/2026 because the district is already officially closed for Mid-Winter Break (confirmed across the RPS academic calendar, district calendar, homepage reminders, and district news posts). Therefore the probability of a *weather-driven* closure announcement is effectively 0%.

If we ignore the calendar and evaluate weather-only operational risk: experts broadly agree there is no accumulating snow/ice event expected. The only meaningful hazard is freezing fog/low clouds with temps near 30–34°F, which can produce localized black ice (bridges/overpasses/shaded rural spots) and reduced visibility around bus hours. Historically in West Michigan, that setup rarely triggers a full closure without verified widespread glazing or widespread visibility <0.5 mile plus incident reports. Power grid conditions are stable (county-level outages essentially zero), and road agencies would typically be in patrol/spot-treatment mode—not overwhelmed. There is a forecast discrepancy where Weather.com looks colder/windier with a trace snow amount, but even that scenario does not meet extreme-cold closure thresholds and would mainly raise caution/slow travel rather than force a closure.

Recommendation: treat Monday as a planned no-school day for RPS; no snow-day call is needed. If any optional programs/activities occur, consider delaying/canceling them only if dense fog (<0.5 mi) or confirmed widespread glazing is observed early Monday morning.

collaboration.summary: Agents reached consensus after 1 round(s) with 2.0% spread. Average probability: 2%.
